meanings.definition: Give or grant someone (power, status, or recognition)
meanings.sent1: She accorded him the title of 'Employee of the Month'.
meanings.sent2: The manager accorded the team more authority to make decisions.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accorded the student the privilege of leading the class in a dance.
meanings.sent4: The king accorded the knight with the power to govern the kingdom in his absence.
meanings.sent5: The judge accorded the defendant a fair trial.

meanings.definition: Agreement or harmony of opinions or actions
meanings.sent1: There was an accord among the group to choose the blue paint.
meanings.sent2: The siblings reached an accord on how to divide their allowance.
meanings.sent3: The accord between the two rival teams surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The accord between the countries brought peace to the region.
meanings.sent5: The accord between the neighbors prevented any disputes.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is consistent or in agreement with
meanings.sent2: The project was completed accord with the timeline.
meanings.sent3: He danced accord to the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted the landscape accord to the natural colors.
meanings.sent5: The student answered the question accord to the textbook.
